    public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object

    Brain of the game, all Logic is here
    Author:
    Joao Almeida , Jose Pedro Machado
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameLogic

        public GameLogic(Map game_map,
                 int guard)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        game_map - Map to be used in the the logic
        guard - Which guard to generate (see Map constructor) If game_map is null default first level will be used, if game_map is not null then it will use its map and its characters, making guard variable irrelevant

    • Method Detail

      • moveAllVillains

        public void moveAllVillains()
        Moves all villains Before moving the villains it checks overlap and if the map is free in that spot. if one of those conditions fail, it will recalculate the position that failed to meet that criteria

      • moveHero

        public boolean moveHero(char direction)
        Moves hero in given direction
        Parameters:
        direction - Direction to move hero
        Returns:
        True if its supposed to go to next level, false otherwise

      • wonGame

        public boolean wonGame()
        Checks if hero got to the final stairs
        Returns:
        true if hero is in final stairs

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Checks if its game over
        Returns:
        True if it is game over, false otherwise First gathers all villains game over positions then checks to see if it is in an adjacent square of any If a villain is an Ogre then only check the first position(its the club), if the hero is armed

      • checkStuck

        private boolean checkStuck(java.util.ArrayList<Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>> positions)
        Checks whether the character can move or if it is stuck
        Parameters:
        positions - Positions of character to check
        Returns:
        True if he is stuck, false if not

      • checkWallStuck

        private int checkWallStuck(Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> p)
        Checks how many walls surround given position
        Parameters:
        p - Position to check
        Returns:
        Number of walls surrounding position

      • inAdjSquares

        private boolean inAdjSquares(Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> p1,
                             Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> p2)
        Checks if p1 is in adjacent square of p2
        Parameters:
        p1 - position to check
        p2 - Position to check + adjacent to these
        Returns:
        True if hero is in adjacent, false if not

      • checkHeroTriggers

        private boolean checkHeroTriggers(Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> p)
        Checks if hero triggered something
        Parameters:
        p - Position of hero
        Returns:
        True if he triggered next level, false otherwise

      • checkStuns

        private void checkStuns(Ogre ch)
        Checks if the hero stunned an Ogre
        Parameters:
        ch - Ogre to check stuns

      • getNextLevel

        public GameLogic getNextLevel(int enemies)
        Returns the next level to go
        Parameters:
        enemies - How many enemies of the next level to generate
        Returns:
        If current game map is DungeonMap it returns an object of ArenaMap, if current is ArenaMap it returns an object of DungeonMap (because of GameLogic(Map,int) specifics), !DO NOT USE TO CHECK GAME OVER!
